name: Karen Vo
summary: Cybersecurity practitioner with 5+ years of experience spanning security automation, cloud red teaming, and detection engineering. Known for building automation that delivers measurable results—94% reduction in alert noise, 85% faster response times—while designing analyst-facing interfaces that actually get used. Translates offensive techniques directly into defensive controls through dual-track red team and detection engineering work.
achievements: Reduced phishing alert volume by 94% through automated severity classification using multi-source log correlation (Entra ID sign-in logs, Graph Activity logs) and threat intelligence enrichment—eliminating spam while preserving high-fidelity threats
Improved incident response times by 85% by architecting SOAR playbooks with intuitive analyst interfaces, reducing cognitive load during triage
Contributed custom integrations to the XSOAR Marketplace, extending platform capabilities for the broader community
Executed cloud red team engagements identifying critical Azure/AWS security gaps, then authored corresponding detection rules to close identified attack paths

Automation & SOAR: Cortex XSOAR (playbooks, custom integrations, UI design)

details: Lead security automation engineering and red team operations, building AI-powered solutions for threat detection, response orchestration, and attack simulation
Design and develop end-to-end XSOAR automation—from Python API integrations and playbook logic to analyst-facing UI components—prioritizing usability alongside functionality
Execute cloud red team engagements (Azure, AWS) and translate findings into detection rules, closing the loop between offensive discovery and defensive coverage
Build automated severity classification using log correlation across Entra ID sign-in logs, Graph Activity logs, and threat intelligence feeds to separate real threats from noise
Develop custom integrations connecting security tools via REST APIs, enabling automated IOC enrichment and cross-platform orchestration workflows
Create external asset reconnaissance tooling for red team engagements, automating discovery and vulnerability identification at scale
Advanced automation program development and detection engineering initiatives
Expanded SOAR playbook coverage across additional security domains
Built and deployed automation solutions across CSOC operations, achieving 85% improvement in incident response times through workflow optimization
Developed custom XSOAR integrations connecting disparate security tools (SIEM, EDR, threat intel platforms), enabling unified workflows and reducing manual handoffs
Designed CTF competitions and tabletop exercises for team development and large-scale incident preparedness
Performed vulnerability assessments and penetration testing using Burp Suite, HCL AppScan, and SAST/DAST tooling
Investigated Tier I/II security alerts across phishing, malware, and network intrusion categories
Conducted threat hunting using Splunk, researching emerging threats and executing IOC blocks
Collaborated with different cybersecurity teams on vendor compromise investigations

publications: O.J. Nielsen, C.L. Carstens, J.W. Lengkong, K.L.Vo, S.T. Andersen, and M.P.S. Andersen, "Atmospheric Chemistry of CH3(CH2)4CN: Kinetics and products of the gas-phase reactions with Cl atoms and OH radicals"

M.S. Andersen, J.W. Lengkong, K.L.Vo, J. Wallberg, F. Hasager, S. Andersen, H. Kjaegaard, T. Wallington, O.J Nielsen, "UV Photolysis and Kinetics and Mechanisms of the reactions of Cl atoms and OH radicals with Hexa- and Penta-Fluorobenzene". Physical Chemistry Chemical Physics.
